definition: to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: Early in the 19th century, the conception of electromagnetic launch was proposed.
sentences.chinese: 早在19世纪就有人提出电磁发射的感念。

sentences.english: We expected to call their care of their families through such a campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望用这样的项目唤起大家对家的感念。

sentences.english: He was very grateful for all the help Tzu Chi had given Cambodia time and again.
sentences.chinese: 他也是感念到了慈济，一而再，再而三地给。

sentences.english: I just would like to take this opportunity to thank for my family.
sentences.chinese: 借此契机，我只想表达对亲人的感念之意。

sentences.english: Or was he just a master of empathy?
sentences.chinese: 或者，它干脆就是一个感念大师？

sentences.english: Local officials recognized volunteers by naming special days in honor of Tzu Chi.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府感念志工，特地将这天命名为慈济日。

sentences.english: There are not enough words to express my sincere gratitude to my parents.
sentences.chinese: 没有更多的言语能表达我对他们的真诚感念之情。

definition: sincerely grateful
benevolence/favor
generous treatment
to recollect
to admire with gratitude
lit. the kindness of recognizing sb's worth and employing him (idiom)/patronage/protection
feelings of gratitude and loyalty
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
to recall with emotion/to feel sentiments
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
to be grateful
favor from an emperor or high official
to shed tears of gratitude (idiom); moved to tears
to be grateful/to appreciate/thankful
to recall/to bring to mind/to reminisce
unable to return the favor
